means: 判断错误的，固执的，坚持错误的

sentence.Network_en: It was wrongheaded because shareholders pay managers to make their company more valuable.
sentence.Network_cn: 这个观点是错误的,因为股东付给管理者报酬是要使公司增值.

sentence.Network_en: Half of Hamburgers want changes to the plans ; a fifth think them completely wrongheaded.
sentence.Network_cn: 这个数字是发起公投所需签名的三倍.

SAT官方指南OG阅读真题10套 - 豆丁网 ... fabrication n. 伪造物 wrongheaded adj. 坚持错误的... chicanery n. 欺骗，强词夺理.
SAT填空_朱培刚_新浪博客 ... （wrongheaded： 顽固且错误的； （derided： 嘲笑；.

list.abs: nor is the potential fallout from Mr Obama's wrongheaded decision limited to trade .奥巴马错误决定的潜在后果并不限于贸易领域。

entry.tran: 冥顽不化的;执迷不悟的
entry.def: If you describe someone as wrong-headed, you mean that although they act in a determined way, their actions and ideas are based on wrong judgments.

means.word_mean: 1. obstinately perverse in judgment or opinion;

auth_sentence.content: Yet it is perversely wrongheaded to write him off as a mere charmer.
auth_sentence.res_content: Yet it is perversely wrongheaded to write him off as a mere charmer.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Yet it is perversely wrongheaded to write him off as a mere charmer.

auth_sentence.content: The crux of the problem, as I learned in my years at the helm, is our wrongheaded approach to risk.
auth_sentence.res_content: The crux of the problem, as I learned in my years at the helm, is our wrongheaded approach to risk.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The crux of the problem, as I learned in my years at the helm, is our wrongheaded approach to risk.

auth_sentence.content: Much of his criticism of conservatism, including his New Republic piece to which Krugman alludes, is wrongheaded in our view.
auth_sentence.res_content: Much of his criticism of conservatism, including his New Republic piece to which Krugman alludes, is wrongheaded in our view.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Much of his criticism of conservatism, including his New Republic piece to which Krugman alludes, is wrongheaded in our view.
